name: Martinique
description: Martinique is the largest island in the Lesser Antilles, a French overseas region and department. Known for its dramatic volcanic landscapes, lush rainforests, stunning beaches, and vibrant culture, it offers a unique blend of Caribbean charm and European sophistication. The island boasts a diverse ecosystem, rich biodiversity, and a thriving tourism industry.

quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city of Martinique.
quickFacts.detail: A vibrant port city with a rich history and a lively cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: A mix of Creole, French, and other European influences.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Martinique enjoys a tropical climate with consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the summer months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest and wettest season, characterized by frequent showers and thunderstorms.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Rainfall gradually decreases, and temperatures remain warm.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The driest season, with sunny days and mild temperatures. A popular time for tourism.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to rise again, and rainfall increases slightly.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Pelée
naturalWonders.description: Mount Pelée is a stratovolcano and the highest point on Martinique, rising to 1,397 meters. It’s known for its devastating 1902 eruption, which buried the city of Saint-Pierre. Today, it’s a popular destination for hiking and offers stunning views.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The volcano's slopes are covered in dense rainforest, supporting a unique ecosystem.  The crater lake, Lacroix, is a remarkable feature.

naturalWonders.name: Tobouïron Natural Park
naturalWonders.description: Tobouïron is a dramatic coastal landscape carved by the erosion of the sea over millions of years. It features towering cliffs, sea caves, and a unique ecosystem.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve and offers stunning views of the Caribbean Sea. The area is rich in marine life and provides excellent opportunities for snorkeling and diving.
viewingTips: Bring waterproof gear for exploring caves

naturalWonders.name: Carbet Falls
naturalWonders.description: Carbet Falls is a series of cascading waterfalls located in the heart of Martinique's rainforest. It's a popular spot for swimming and picnicking.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The falls are surrounded by lush vegetation and offer a refreshing escape from the tropical heat. Several pools provide opportunities for swimming and relaxation.
bestLocations: Swimming pools at the base of the falls

biodiversityCategory.name: Rainforest Ecosystem
biodiversityCategory.description: Martinique’s rainforests are incredibly diverse, harboring a vast array of plant and animal species, many of which are endemic to the island.

statistics.details: Including numerous endemic species of palms, figs, and hardwoods.
Home to the Martinique Parrot (Psittacus martineaum), a critically endangered species.

notableSpecies.name: Martinique Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: A unique and endemic parrot species, facing severe threats due to habitat loss and poaching.

notableSpecies.name: Golden Lion Tamarin
notableSpecies.significance: A small, brightly colored monkey found in the rainforests of Martinique.

ecosystemData.title: Martinique's Rainforest Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Martinique’s rainforests represent a vital part of the island’s biodiversity and play a crucial role in regulating the climate. These ecosystems are characterized by high rainfall, dense vegetation, and a remarkable variety of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rainforest Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: The dominant ecosystem, characterized by dense vegetation and high biodiversity.

statistics.details: A diverse range of mammals, birds, reptiles, and amphibians.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: The coastal areas of Martinique are home to diverse marine life and provide important habitats for seabirds and other animals.

statistics.details: Supporting a rich diversity of marine species.
